data.title: Bowling Green State University
data.meta_description: For the fifth year in a row, BGSU Athletics will be counting down the top stories of the year leading into the beginning of the fall athletics season. With c...
data.text:
For the fifth year in a row, BGSU Athletics will be counting down the top stories of the year leading into the beginning of the fall athletics season. With conference championships, individual honors, national tournament appearances and many other events, the 2013-14 season was a banner year.

We will release the list one at a time throughout the summer until the No. 1 story of the year is announced on Aug. 1 -- just as #FalconFast BGSU football camp gets underway and the 2014-15 season has officially started! Don't forget to purchase your season tickets NOW! As well, single game tickets went on sale today. Find out more information by CLICKING HERE!

Today we announce the No. 1 story of the year:

BGSU Football Wins MAC Championship

Entering the 2013 football season, expectations were high for the BGSU Football team after going 8-5 the year before. And those expectations were met as Bowling Green went 10-4 on the year, won the MAC East Division and beat then-undefeated Northern Illinois in the MAC Championship game. The season started off with a bang, beginning with a 34-7 win over Tulsa that sparked the team to a 5-1 start. After two losses, by a combined four points, dropped the team to 5-3, Bowling Green started one of the most dominant stretches of football played by anyone. Over the final four games of the regular season, the Falcons allowed just one offensive touchdown. BGSU outscored Miami, Ohio, Eastern Michigan and Buffalo by a combined total of 176-17 to clinch the East Division and a trip to the MAC Championship game. Facing 12-0 Northern Illinois, ranked No. 14 in the country, Bowling Green steamrolled the Huskies 47-27, compiling 574 yards of offense along the way. Relive the season through our YouTube playlist (CLICK HERE) or go directly to the MAC Championship highlight video (CLICK HERE).

Countdown of the Top Ten Stories of 2013-14

No. 1 - Football Wins MAC Championship

No. 2 - Pleger's Record-Breaking Season

No. 3 - Women's Basketball Wins MAC Title, Makes Deep WNIT Run

No. 4 - BGSU Supporters Donate At Historic Levels

No. 5 - Pettigrew Wins MAC Title, Sets School Record At MAC Indoor Championships

No. 6 - Roos Recognized As Coach Of The Year By MAC And Region 4

No. 7 - Babers and Jans Hired To Lead Football And Men's Basketball Programs

No. 8 - Chiricosta Named MAC Tennis Player Of The Year

No. 9 - BGSU Hockey Sweeps Michigan Tech To Advance To Final Five In Year One Of WCHA Era

No. 10 - BGSU Volleyball Beats #13 BYU For First Win Over A Ranked Opponent In Program History

Honorable Mention

Fans can review previous top 10 lists by clicking any of the links below:

2012-13 Top 10: No. 1 Moment - Volleyball wins MAC Tournament, NCAA Tournament Match

2011-12 Top 10: No. 1 Moment - BGSU hockey makes improbable run to the Joe

2010-11 Top 10: No. 1 Moment - Bill Frack announces $10 million gift to BGSU men's basketball

2009-10 Top 10: No. 1 Moment - The Freddie Barnes Story
